title: Eye or sphere
data:
The **eye or sphere** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [e](/wiki/E "E") glyph (e). Eyes and spheres are designated internally by the macro **S\_EYE**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- e [gas spore](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore")
- e [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")
- e [flaming sphere](/wiki/Flaming_sphere "Flaming sphere")
- e [freezing sphere](/wiki/Freezing_sphere "Freezing sphere")
- e [shocking sphere](/wiki/Shocking_sphere "Shocking sphere")
- Deferred monster:
  - e [beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(monster\) "Beholder (monster)")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Body parts](#Body_parts)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [5 References](#References)

## Common traits

Eyes and spheres are round [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") monsters without limbs or a head that are capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight")—except for the floating eye, all of them are [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless"), and they can all be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") except for the gas spore.

The three spheres use [explosion attacks](/wiki/Explosion_attack "Explosion attack") that target the defender's square, destroying themselves and inflicting elemental damage to the target as well as their open [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory"); the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") can "duck" these explosions and take reduced damage based on their [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity"), and will take no damage at all if they have the appropriate resistance [property](/wiki/Property "Property"). Gas spores do not actively attack, though they explode on death in a 3x3 square centered on their tile.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 6b60618e](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932), spheres create actual explosions with their attacks, which cover a 3x3 area around them and affect items and other monsters caught within the blast radius - this does not count the inventory of a hero that is [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a sphere and explodes. This is adapted from [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), and the spheres' [base difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") are each also raised from 8 to 9.

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec6ea2821693a7131c97), extrinsic elemental resistance properties protect the open inventory from damage by that element 99⁄100 of the time. Per [commit 67295bc7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/67295bc706525934c461a0d940ca0da39fc302d2), wearing non-[metallic](/wiki/Metallic "Metallic") [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") will protect worn [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") from shock damage.

Per [commit ef6a88e1](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef6a88e1e10287c7e09fb8f7f5cf97bc877103d2), chargeable rings hit by the explosion of a shocking sphere and other forms of shock damage may be [charged](/wiki/Charged "Charged") rather than destroyed.

### Body parts

**Sphere** also refers to the grouping of [body parts](/wiki/Body_parts "Body parts") for the forms of bulbous creatures like the monsters in this monster class - this grouping is used primarily to maintain a sort of symmetry between spheres and other monsters, e.g. whenever the hero or a monster is transformed into a sphere while wearing certain items. It affects the messages referring to the appropriate body parts as follows:[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

| Bodypart[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) | Description                                                                 |
| ----------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Arm                           | Appendage                                                                   |
| Eye                           | Optic nerve (cornea for [floating eyes](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")) |
| Face                          | Body                                                                        |
| Finger                        | Tentacle                                                                    |
| Fingertip                     | Tentacle tip                                                                |
| Foot                          | Lower appendage                                                             |
| Hand                          | Tentacle                                                                    |
| Handed                        | Tentacled                                                                   |
| Head                          | Body                                                                        |
| Leg                           | Lower tentacle                                                              |
| Light Headed                  | Rotational                                                                  |
| Neck                          | Equator                                                                     |
| Spine                         | Body                                                                        |
| Toe                           | Lower tentacle tip                                                          |
| Hair                          | Cilia                                                                       |
| Blood                         | Life force                                                                  |
| Lung                          | Retina                                                                      |
| Nose                          | Olfactory nerve                                                             |
| Stomach                       | Interior                                                                    |

## Strategy

The gas sphere and floating eye are two of the bigger threats for an inattentive hero in the early game: the former can blast a starting character to death if the explosion deals enough damage, while a character frozen by the floating eye's [paralyzing](/wiki/Paralyzing "Paralyzing") [passive](/wiki/Passive "Passive") [gaze](/wiki/Gaze "Gaze") has a high risk of dying to any nearby hostile or even [starvation](/wiki/Starvation "Starvation") if they are paralyzed long enough.

The elemental spheres are quite annoying, but can be dealt with by quickly dropping or stashing vulnerable items before engaging one; they can also be put to [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") or immobilized, though the former option is preferable for a hero low on resources. Pets that attack spheres may end up being targeted by their explosions instead, which can make them effective guards. Be sure to check for spheres when entering a [treasure zoo](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo"), even if you have [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") - the spheres' explosions will wake up most of the denizens.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Shocking spheres are now considered a target for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") due to the item destruction threat.

## History

The floating eye and freezing sphere appear in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0")—in Hack 1.21, the evil eye (not to be confused with the [evil eye](/wiki/Evil_eye "Evil eye") from variants of *NetHack*) and ice ball are somewhat similar monsters included in the bestiary.

[NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") introduces the eye or sphere monster class and moves the floating eye and freezing sphere to their current glyphs. The flaming sphere first appears in [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), and makes its vanilla debut alongside the gas spore and shocking sphere in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, flaming and shocking spheres are capable of picking up items—this is [bug C343-138](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3"), and is fixed via [commit cbab68a4](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/cbab68a4bb0abfa23e695d48bd17806c85e5974f).

## Variants

Many variants make the deferred beholder functional as part of adding new monsters to the monster class.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") implements [the Beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Beholder (SLASH'EM)") as the boss of the [Neutral Quest](/wiki/Neutral_Quest "Neutral Quest") and adds two other monsters to the monster class:

- e [bloodshot eye](/wiki/Bloodshot_eye "Bloodshot eye")
- e [blinking eye](/wiki/Blinking_eye "Blinking eye")
- e [Beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Beholder (SLASH'EM)")

### GruntHack

[GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack") implements the [beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(GruntHack\) "Beholder (GruntHack)") and gives it significant buffs.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") implements the [beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(dNetHack\) "Beholder (dNetHack)") and changes it significantly, and adds several other monsters to the monster class:

- e [monoton](/wiki/Monoton "Monoton")
- e [duton](/wiki/Duton "Duton")
- e [triton](/wiki/Triton "Triton")
- e [quaton](/wiki/Quaton "Quaton")
- e [quinon](/wiki/Quinon "Quinon")
- e [ballistospore](/index.php?title=Ballistospore\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ballistospore (page does not exist)")
- e [pursuer](/wiki/Pursuer "Pursuer")
- e [vexing orb](/wiki/Vexing_orb "Vexing orb")
- e [flaming orb](/index.php?title=Flaming_orb\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Flaming orb (page does not exist)")
- e [beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(dNetHack\) "Beholder (dNetHack)")
- e [ball of light](/wiki/Ball_of_light "Ball of light")
- e [eye of doom](/wiki/Eye_of_doom "Eye of doom")
- e [ball of radiance](/wiki/Ball_of_radiance "Ball of radiance")
- e [aphanactonan audient](/index.php?title=Aphanactonan_audient\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Aphanactonan audient (page does not exist)")
- e [aphanactonan assessor](/index.php?title=Aphanactonan_assessor\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Aphanactonan assessor (page does not exist)")
- e [bloody sunset](/wiki/Bloody_sunset "Bloody sunset")
- e [ball of gossamer sunlight](/wiki/Ball_of_gossamer_sunlight "Ball of gossamer sunlight")
- e [eternal light](/wiki/Eternal_light "Eternal light")
- e [dungeon fern spore](/wiki/Dungeon_fern_spore "Dungeon fern spore")
- e [swamp fern spore](/wiki/Swamp_fern_spore "Swamp fern spore")
- e [burning fern spore](/wiki/Burning_fern_spore "Burning fern spore")
- e [many-eyed seeker](/index.php?title=Many-eyed_seeker\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Many-eyed seeker (page does not exist)")
- e [Axus](/wiki/Axus "Axus")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 19](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L19)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 300](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L300)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1639](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L1639)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/hack.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 410](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/hack.h#L410)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Eye or sphere

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The eye or sphere is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase e glyph (e). Eyes and spheres are designated internally by the macro S_EYE.[1]

The class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • e gas spore
  • e floating eye
  • e flaming sphere
  • e freezing sphere
  • e shocking sphere
  • Deferred monster:
    • e beholder

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Body parts
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 GruntHack
    • 4.3 dNetHack
  • 5 References

Common traits

Eyes and spheres are round unbreathing monsters without limbs or a head that are capable of flight—except for the floating eye, all of them are mindless, and they can all be seen via infravision except for the gas spore.

The three spheres use explosion attacks that target the defender's square, destroying themselves and inflicting elemental damage to the target as well as their open inventory; the hero can "duck" these explosions and take reduced damage based on their dexterity, and will take no damage at all if they have the appropriate resistance property. Gas spores do not actively attack, though they explode on death in a 3x3 square centered on their tile.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 6b60618e, spheres create actual explosions with their attacks, which cover a 3x3 area around them and affect items and other monsters caught within the blast radius - this does not count the inventory of a hero that is polymorphed into a sphere and explodes. This is adapted from xNetHack, and the spheres' base difficulty are each also raised from 8 to 9.

Per commit 9942b65d, extrinsic elemental resistance properties protect the open inventory from damage by that element 99⁄100 of the time. Per commit 67295bc7, wearing non-metallic gloves will protect worn rings from shock damage.

Per commit ef6a88e1, chargeable rings hit by the explosion of a shocking sphere and other forms of shock damage may be charged rather than destroyed.

Body parts

Sphere also refers to the grouping of body parts for the forms of bulbous creatures like the monsters in this monster class - this grouping is used primarily to maintain a sort of symmetry between spheres and other monsters, e.g. whenever the hero or a monster is transformed into a sphere while wearing certain items. It affects the messages referring to the appropriate body parts as follows:[3]

Bodypart[4] Description
Arm Appendage
Eye Optic nerve (cornea for floating eyes)
Face Body
Finger Tentacle
Fingertip Tentacle tip
Foot Lower appendage
Hand Tentacle
Handed Tentacled
Head Body
Leg Lower tentacle
Light Headed Rotational
Neck Equator
Spine Body
Toe Lower tentacle tip
Hair Cilia
Blood Life force
Lung Retina
Nose Olfactory nerve
Stomach Interior

Strategy

The gas sphere and floating eye are two of the bigger threats for an inattentive hero in the early game: the former can blast a starting character to death if the explosion deals enough damage, while a character frozen by the floating eye's paralyzing passive gaze has a high risk of dying to any nearby hostile or even starvation if they are paralyzed long enough.

The elemental spheres are quite annoying, but can be dealt with by quickly dropping or stashing vulnerable items before engaging one; they can also be put to sleep or immobilized, though the former option is preferable for a hero low on resources. Pets that attack spheres may end up being targeted by their explosions instead, which can make them effective guards. Be sure to check for spheres when entering a treasure zoo, even if you have stealth - the spheres' explosions will wake up most of the denizens.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Shocking spheres are now considered a target for genocide due to the item destruction threat.

History

The floating eye and freezing sphere appear in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial bestiary for Hack 1.0—in Hack 1.21, the evil eye (not to be confused with the evil eye from variants of NetHack) and ice ball are somewhat similar monsters included in the bestiary.

NetHack 3.0.0 introduces the eye or sphere monster class and moves the floating eye and freezing sphere to their current glyphs. The flaming sphere first appears in NetHack-- 3.0.10, and makes its vanilla debut alongside the gas spore and shocking sphere in NetHack 3.3.0.

In NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, flaming and shocking spheres are capable of picking up items—this is bug C343-138, and is fixed via commit cbab68a4.

Variants

Many variants make the deferred beholder functional as part of adding new monsters to the monster class.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM implements the Beholder as the boss of the Neutral Quest and adds two other monsters to the monster class:

  • e bloodshot eye
  • e blinking eye
  • e Beholder

GruntHack

GruntHack implements the beholder and gives it significant buffs.

dNetHack

dNetHack implements the beholder and changes it significantly, and adds several other monsters to the monster class:

  • e monoton
  • e duton
  • e triton
  • e quaton
  • e quinon
  • e ballistospore
  • e pursuer
  • e vexing orb
  • e flaming orb
  • e beholder
  • e ball of light
  • e eye of doom
  • e ball of radiance
  • e aphanactonan audient
  • e aphanactonan assessor
  • e bloody sunset
  • e ball of gossamer sunlight
  • e eternal light
  • e dungeon fern spore
  • e swamp fern spore
  • e burning fern spore
  • e many-eyed seeker
  • e Axus

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 19
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 300
  3. ↑ src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1639
  4. ↑ src/hack.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 410

rawPage:
The '''eye or sphere''' is a [[monster class]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'', and is represented by the lowercase [[e]] glyph ({{white|e}}). Eyes and spheres are designated internally by the macro '''S_EYE'''.{{refsrc|include/monsym.h|19|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

The class contains the following monsters:{{refsrc|src/monst.c|300|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

* {{monsymlink|gas spore}}
* {{monsymlink|floating eye}}
* {{monsymlink|flaming sphere}}
* {{monsymlink|freezing sphere}}
* {{monsymlink|shocking sphere}}
* Deferred monster:
** {{monsymlink|beholder}}

==Common traits==
Eyes and spheres are round [[unbreathing]] monsters without limbs or a head that are capable of [[flight]]—except for the floating eye, all of them are [[mindless]], and they can all be seen via [[infravision]] except for the gas spore.

The three spheres use [[explosion attack]]s that target the defender's square, destroying themselves and inflicting elemental damage to the target as well as their open [[inventory]]; the [[hero]] can "duck" these explosions and take reduced damage based on their [[dexterity]], and will take no damage at all if they have the appropriate resistance [[property]]. Gas spores do not actively attack, though they explode on death in a 3x3 square centered on their tile.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932}}, spheres create actual explosions with their attacks, which cover a 3x3 area around them and affect items and other monsters caught within the blast radius - this does not count the inventory of a hero that is [[polymorph]]ed into a sphere and explodes. This is adapted from [[xNetHack]], and the spheres' [[Monster difficulty|base difficulty]] are each also raised from 8 to 9.

Per {{commit|9942b65df78dd55a7806ec6ea2821693a7131c97}}, extrinsic elemental resistance properties protect the open inventory from damage by that element {{frac|99|100}} of the time. Per {{commit|67295bc706525934c461a0d940ca0da39fc302d2}}, wearing non-[[metallic]] [[gloves]] will protect worn [[ring]]s from shock damage.

Per {{commit|ef6a88e1e10287c7e09fb8f7f5cf97bc877103d2}}, chargeable rings hit by the explosion of a shocking sphere and other forms of shock damage may be [[charged]] rather than destroyed.}}

===Body parts===
'''Sphere''' also refers to the grouping of [[body parts]] for the forms of bulbous creatures like the monsters in this monster class - this grouping is used primarily to maintain a sort of symmetry between spheres and other monsters, e.g. whenever the hero or a monster is transformed into a sphere while wearing certain items. It affects the messages referring to the appropriate body parts as follows:{{refsrc|src/polyself.c|1639|nethack=3.6.7}}

{| class="prettytable"
!Bodypart{{refsrc|src/hack.h|410|nethack=3.6.7}}!!Description
|-
|Arm||Appendage
|-
|Eye||Optic nerve (cornea for [[floating eye]]s)
|-
|Face||Body
|-
|Finger||Tentacle
|-

|-

|Toe||Lower tentacle tip
|-
|Hair||Cilia
|-
|Blood||Life force

|Lung||Retina

|Nose||Olfactory nerve

|Stomach||Interior

==Strategy==
The gas sphere and floating eye are two of the bigger threats for an inattentive hero in the early game: the former can blast a starting character to death if the explosion deals enough damage, while a character frozen by the floating eye's [[paralyzing]] [[passive]] [[gaze]] has a high risk of dying to any nearby hostile or even [[starvation]] if they are paralyzed long enough.

The elemental spheres are quite annoying, but can be dealt with by quickly dropping or stashing vulnerable items before engaging one; they can also be put to [[sleep]] or immobilized, though the former option is preferable for a hero low on resources. Pets that attack spheres may end up being targeted by their explosions instead, which can make them effective guards. Be sure to check for spheres when entering a [[treasure zoo]], even if you have [[stealth]] - the spheres' explosions will wake up most of the denizens.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Shocking spheres are now considered a target for [[genocide]] due to the item destruction threat.}}

==History==
The floating eye and freezing sphere appear in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial bestiary for [[Hack 1.0]]—in Hack 1.21, the evil eye (not to be confused with the [[evil eye]] from variants of ''NetHack'') and ice ball are somewhat similar monsters included in the bestiary.

[[NetHack 3.0.0]] introduces the eye or sphere monster class and moves the floating eye and freezing sphere to their current glyphs. The flaming sphere first appears in [[NetHack-- 3.0.10]], and makes its vanilla debut alongside the gas spore and shocking sphere in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, flaming and shocking spheres are capable of picking up items—this is [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3|bug C343-138]], and is fixed via {{commit|cbab68a4bb0abfa23e695d48bd17806c85e5974f}}.

==Variants==
Many variants make the deferred beholder functional as part of adding new monsters to the monster class.

===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] implements [[Beholder (SLASH'EM)|the Beholder]] as the boss of the [[Neutral Quest]] and adds two other monsters to the monster class:

* {{monsymlink|bloodshot eye}}
* {{monsymlink|blinking eye}}
* {{monsymlink|Beholder|variant=SLASH'EM}}

===GruntHack===
[[GruntHack]] implements the [[Beholder (GruntHack)|beholder]] and gives it significant buffs.

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] implements the [[Beholder (dNetHack)|beholder]] and changes it significantly, and adds several other monsters to the monster class:

* {{brown|e}} [[monoton]]
* {{yellow|e}} [[duton]]
* {{brightgreen|e}} [[triton]]
* {{brightcyan|e}} [[quaton]]
* {{brightmagenta|e}} [[quinon]]
* {{orange|e}} [[ballistospore]]
* {{black|e}} [[pursuer]]
* {{magenta|e}} [[vexing orb]]
* {{yellow|e}} [[flaming orb]]
* {{monsymlink|beholder|variant=dNetHack}}
* {{cyan|e}} [[ball of light]]
* {{blue|e}} [[eye of doom]]
* {{brightmagenta|e}} [[ball of radiance]]
* {{gray|e}} [[aphanactonan audient]]
* {{orange|e}} [[aphanactonan assessor]]
* {{magenta|e}} [[bloody sunset]]
* {{brightmagenta|e}} [[ball of gossamer sunlight]]
* {{brightmagenta|e}} [[eternal light]]
* {{green|e}} [[dungeon fern spore]]
* {{magenta|e}} [[swamp fern spore]]
* {{black|e}} [[burning fern spore]]
* {{blue|e}} [[many-eyed seeker]]
* {{magenta|e}} [[Axus]]
